meanings.definition: To cause a person or animal to feel sudden shock or alarm.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise startled the cat.
meanings.sent2: She startled when the door slammed shut.
meanings.sent3: The prankster jumped out to startle his friend.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected thunderstorm startled the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The sudden clap of thunder startled the sleeping baby awake.

meanings.definition: Feeling or showing sudden shock or alarm.
meanings.sent1: The startled expression on her face was priceless.
meanings.sent2: He looked startled when the fire alarm went off.
meanings.sent3: The startled puppy barked at its own reflection.
meanings.sent4: The startled deer froze in the headlights.
meanings.sent5: Her startled reaction to the surprise party was heartwarming.
